jobDescription: Job Description: GM Customer Care and Aftersales (CCA) markets automotive replacement parts worldwide for GM and non-GM vehicles through four distinct distribution channels, which include GM dealers, wholesale distributors, ACDelco warehouse distributors, and consumer-related outlets such as auto parts and general discount stores. GM's Customer Care & Aftersales is the only business unit that supports the vehicle for its entire lifecycle. Approximately 5,600 hourly and salaried employees work within GM North America CCA including 29 warehouse facilities, Central Office, Engineering and Technical Centers, and field sales regions within the United States, Canada and Mexico.  The CCA Data Analytics group is responsible for developing analytics-driven solutions to help CCA achieve its business goals. The solutions would be implemented across a number of touch points which may include web-sites, dealerships, field sales, or central office. The individual will work as a member of a multi-disciplinary team of individuals of various levels of experience who will be driving opportunity identification and solution design, development, and deployment of machine learning models across the CCA organization. The team is responsible for both advanced analytics strategy and applied, project-based solutions, focusing on the company's most critical business areas.  This is a unique opportunity to be a part of team that will develop technical strategies and drive value from a big data approach to advanced analytics, machine learning and/or cognitive computing.
